sectiondef.header: Function managing the configuration loaded by the tool

briefdescription.para: Function caching the information out of the metadata tree.

detaileddescription.para: This function should be called whenever a new file is opened by the analysis code. It reads in all the information from the metadata TTree into memory in one go, so the users can access the metadata tree however they want after the function is finished.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the metadata tree holding the bunch configuration
If set to true (default value) then the already known configurations are forgotten by the tool. This is good practice in general to keep the memory consumption of the tool low in a big job.

simplesect.para: StatusCode::SUCCESS if the caching was successful, or StatusCode::FAILURE otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Function loading a the configuration corresponding to a given configuration ID
This function should be called whenever processing a new D3PD event. It tries to be as smart as possible, to do as little as possible. So it should be safe to call it in every event.
You should yourself read the configuration ID from the event information in the D3PD, and pass that to this function.
Of course you should also not forget about caching the configurations of the current file using cacheConfig(...).

parameterdescription.para: The configuration ID of the current event

simplesect.para: StatusCode::SUCCESS if the loading of the configuration was successful, or StatusCode::FAILURE otherwise

briefdescription.para: Function checking if a given configuration key is known.

detaileddescription.para: This function can be used to figure out if a given configuration is available to the tool currently. It is mostly used by the Athena version of the tool to decide when to read in new metadata.

parameterdescription.para: The configuration ID that is to be checked

simplesect.para: true if the configuration is available, false if it's not

briefdescription.para: Get the number of filled bunches in the current configuration.

detaileddescription.para: In case the tool is not configured correctly (we're processing a non-pileup MC file) it should not report 0 filled bunches, but 1. The override of this function makes sure that this is what happens...
Cached configurations We need to be explicit about the namespace of Trig::BunchConfig, otherwise the dictionary generator fails in ROOT 5.

briefdescription.para: Flag specifying if any configuration is loaded already.
The currently loaded configuration ID.
Flag specifying whether we use a "valid" configuration.
Create a proper constructor for Athena.

detaileddescription.para: Default constructor

briefdescription.para: Function reading the V1 metadata format.
Function reading the V2 metadata format.
Stand-alone bunch crossing tool for processing D3PD files.

detaileddescription.para: This implementation was designed to be used for processing D3PD files which have the bunch configuration stored in them as metadata.

Each time you open a new D3PD file you need to call the cacheConfig(...) function, and for each event you need to call the loadConfig(...) function. This way the tool is always configured correctly in your analysis. Unfortunately unlike in Athena, there's no way of doing this automatically behing the scenes in this tool...
This tool has no Athena front-end, as it would make no sense.
